raw_text: While early approaches to the NP-chunking task (Cardie and Pierce, 1998) relied on part-of-speech information alone, it is widely accepted that lexical information (word forms) is crucial for building accurate systems for these tasks
clean_text: While early approaches to the NP-chunking task (Cardie and Pierce, 1998) relied on part-of-speech information alone, it is widely accepted that lexical information (word forms) is crucial for building accurate systems for these tasks.

citing_paper_authors: Yoav, Goldberg | Meni, Adler | Michael, Elhadad
raw_text: The results were evaluated using the CoNLL shared task evaluation tools 5. The approaches tested were Error Driven Pruning (EDP) (Cardie and Pierce, 1998) and Transformational Based Learning of IOB tagging (TBL) (Ramshaw and Marcus, 1995)
clean_text: The approaches tested were Error Driven Pruning (EDP) (Cardie and Pierce, 1998) and Transformational Based Learning of IOB tagging (TBL) (Ramshaw and Marcus, 1995).

citing_paper_authors: Yoav, Goldberg | Meni, Adler | Michael, Elhadad
raw_text: Conjunctions are a major source of errors for English chunking as well (Ramshaw and Marcus, 1995, Cardie and Pierce, 1998) 9, and we plan to address them in future work
clean_text: Conjunctions are a major source of errors for English chunking as well (Ramshaw and Marcus, 1995, Cardie and Pierce, 1998), and we plan to address them in future work.

citing_paper_authors: Claire, Cardie | Vincent, Ng | David R., Pierce | Chris, Buckley
raw_text: Our implementation of the NP-based QA system uses the Empire noun phrase finder, which is described in detail in Cardie and Pierce (1998)
clean_text: Our implementation of the NP-based QA system uses the Empire noun phrase finder, which is described in detail in Cardie and Pierce (1998).

raw_text: (Cardie and Pierce, 1998, 1999) applied a scoring method to select new rules and a naive heuristic for matching rules to evaluate the results &apos ;accu racy
clean_text: (Cardie and Pierce, 1998, 1999) applied a scoring method to select new rules and a naive heuristic for matching rules to evaluate the results and accuracy.

raw_text: (Cardie and Pierce, 1998) present an approach to chunking based on a mixture of finite state and context-free techniques
clean_text: (Cardie and Pierce, 1998) present an approach to chunking based on a mixture of finite state and context-free techniques.

raw_text: (Cardie and Pierce, 1998) store POS tag sequences that make up complete chunks and use these sequences as rules for classifying unseen data
clean_text: (Cardie and Pierce, 1998) store POS tag sequences that make up complete chunks and use these sequences as rules for classifying unseen data.

raw_text: We tested this hypothesis by training the Error-Driven Pruning (EDP) method of (Cardie and Pierce, 1998) with an extended set of features
